doc.field: - Echlin Inc said it expects further earnings increases for the second half of fiscal 1987 ending in August due to unit sales growth and improved operations. "As expected, market conditions have improved so that demand for automotive replacement parts is gradually and steadily expanding," Echlin president Frederick Mancheski said. Earlier, Echlin reported first half fiscal 1987, ended Feb 28, earnings of 23.2 mln dlrs, or 48 cts a share, up from 16.6 mln, or 40 cts a share, in the prior year's first half. Also, Echlin said it had second quarter net income of 11.8 mln dlrs, or 24 cts per share, compared with net income of 8.3 mln dlrs, or 20 cts a share, in fiscal 1986's second quarter.
